section.title: Pre-Install Requirements and Prerequisites
section.para: Ensure that the following requirements have been met before continuing with the installation.

section.title: Software Prerequisites
section.para: The Remote SLEE Connection Tool is a JCA connector, therefore, it requires a Java EE platform to run.

section.title: &THIS.PLATFORM; Remote SLEE Connection Tool Source Code

step.title: Downloading the source code

important.para: Git is used to manage Mobicents JAIN SLEE source code. Instructions for downloading, installing and using Git can be found at

step.para: Use Git to checkout a specific release source from the Git repository URL at https://code.google.com/p/jain-slee.javaee/ . You can choose a specific release version like the following: &THIS.VERSION;.

step.title: Building the source code

important.para: Maven 2.0.9 (or higher) is used to build the release. Instructions for using Maven2, including install, can be found at

step.para: Use Maven to build the deployable unit binary.

Once the build is completed, you should have the JCA mobicents-slee-remote-connection.rar directory artifact in the target/mobicents-slee-remote-connection.rar-beans directory. Deploying the JCA connector depends on the Java EE platform used. In the case of &JEE.PLATFORM;, simply copy the directory artifact to the platform's deploy directory.

section.title: Installing &THIS.PLATFORM; Remote SLEE Connection Tool
section.para: To install the tool to the &JEE.PLATFORM; simply copy the provided mobicents-slee-remote-connection.rar directory into the deploy directory of the target server profile.
For other Java EE platforms, please refer to the appropriate documentation on how to deploy the JCA connector.

section.title: Uninstalling &THIS.PLATFORM; Remote SLEE Connection Tool
section.para: To uninstall the tool from the &JEE.PLATFORM; simply delete the mobicents-slee-remote-connection.rar directory from the deploy directory of the target server profile.
For other Java EE platforms, please refer to the appropriate documentation on how to undeploy the JCA connector.
